objective: Understand the foundational principles of accounting.
content: The accounting cycle, basic concepts (going concern, accruals, consistency), and the accounting equation.
specific_objectives: Define accounting and state its purposes
Identify the users of accounting information
Explain the accounting equation: Assets = Liabilities + Capital
Describe basic accounting concepts: Double Entry, Business Entity, Periodicity
Analyze the impact of transactions on the accounting equation

subsection: Books of Original Entry and Ledger
objective: Record business transactions accurately using standardized formats.
content: Journals, Sales/Purchases books, and the General Ledger. Focuses on double-entry bookkeeping.
specific_objectives: Record transactions in the Cash Book (two-column and three-column)
Record transactions in the Petty Cash Book using the Imprest System
Enter data into the Sales, Purchases, and Returns books
Post entries from books of original entry to the Ledger
Balance accounts and prepare a Trial Balance

objective: Maintain the integrity of accounting records.
content: Bank reconciliation statements and the correction of errors using the Journal and Suspense Account.
specific_objectives: Explain the purpose of a Bank Reconciliation Statement
Adjust the Cash Book for bank charges, interests, and errors
Prepare a Bank Reconciliation Statement starting with the adjusted Cash Book balance
Identify and correct errors that do not affect the Trial Balance
Use a Suspense Account to correct errors that affect the Trial Balance

section: Section 4: Financial Statements of the Sole Trader
objective: Prepare and interpret financial results for a sole proprietorship.
content: Trading and Profit & Loss Accounts (Statement of Comprehensive Income) and Balance Sheets (Statement of Financial Position).
specific_objectives: Prepare a Trading Account to determine Gross Profit/Loss
Prepare a Profit and Loss Account for a sole trader
Prepare a Balance Sheet (Statement of Financial Position) with appropriate classifications
Apply end-of-period adjustments: Depreciation, Accruals, and Prepayments
Explain and calculate depreciation using Straight Line and Reducing Balance methods

objective: Account for businesses owned by multiple individuals.
content: Partnership agreements, Appropriation accounts, and Current accounts.
specific_objectives: Identify the features of a partnership
Prepare an Appropriation Account for a partnership
Maintain Capital and Current Accounts for partners
Prepare the Balance Sheet for a partnership

objective: Analyze financial statements to assess business performance.
content: Profitability and liquidity ratios. Understanding what the numbers mean for stakeholders.
specific_objectives: Calculate profitability ratios: Gross Profit Margin, Net Profit Margin, ROCE
Calculate liquidity ratios: Current Ratio, Acid Test (Quick) Ratio
Calculate efficiency ratios: Stock Turnover, Debtor's Days
Comment on the financial performance of a business based on calculated ratios
